sentences.en: "You're an obstinate man," she said. "Is that a criticism," I said, "or just an observation?".
sentences.cn: “你是个很执拗的人，”她说道。“你这是批评呢，”我说，“还是只是发表评论而已？”

sentences.en: But she was, in reality, self - willed, vain and obstinate.
sentences.cn: 但在骨子里, 她却是刚愎 、 执拗而且爱虚荣的.

sentences.en: Formal, exact and obstinate, he was also cold, suspicious, touchy and tactless.
sentences.cn: 严肃、严谨、倔强的他同时又冷漠、多疑、敏感、不会变通。

sentences.en: He can be very obstinate when he wants to be!
sentences.cn: 他的犟劲儿一上来，简直执拗得要命！

sentences.en: He is obstinate and determined and will not give up.
sentences.cn: 他非常顽固，而且又铁了心，是不会放弃的。

sentences.en: He is very obstinate; you won't be able to make him change his mind.
sentences.cn: 他这个人脾气犟, 你可拗不过他.

sentences.en: He returned frowning, his face obstinate but whistling jauntily.
sentences.cn: 他回来时皱眉蹙额,板着脸,嘴上却快活地吹着口哨.

sentences.en: He was the most obstinate man I’ve ever met.
sentences.cn: 他是我遇到过的最固执的人。

sentences.en: She was a wicked and obstinate child.
sentences.cn: 她是个淘气又执拗的孩子。

sentences.en: She was as obstinate as a mule.
She's too obstinate to let anyone help her.
sentences.cn: 她太倔强了,不会让任何人帮她的.

sentences.en: The obstinate child refused to answer.
sentences.cn: 这固执的孩子拒绝回答.

sentences.en: The old man was in bed with an obstinate disease.
sentences.cn: 这老人因痼疾已卧床很久了.

sentences.en: The third, a long - legged creature, was more obstinate and agile.
sentences.cn: 第三只却因为腿长, 更倔强,更俏利.

sentences.en: The trader was obstinate in the negotiation.
sentences.cn: 这个商人在谈判中拗强固执.

words.tran_cn: 固执，顽固；（病痛等的）难治，难解除

trans.tran_cn: 顽固的，固执的，难于控制的，方头不劣
trans.tran_en: determined not to change your ideas, behaviour, opinions etc, even when other people think you are being unreasonable
